Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶

Default route to indicate that the application has started.

async main.startup()¶

Function to initialize Redis and FastAPILimiter on application startup.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactResponse, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactResponse) – ContactResponse instance containing contact information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

Returns:

The created Contact instance or None if an IntegrityError occurs.

Return type:

Contact or None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a contact from database session.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – An id of the contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

Returns:

The Contact instance or None

Return type:

Contact or None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specified user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before retrieving.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

Returns:

A list of Contact instances.

Return type:

list

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

Returns:

The Contact instance

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.search_contact(user: User, db: AsyncSession, contact_name: str, surname: str, email: str)¶

Searches for a contact based on the provided criteria.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • contact_name (str) – The name of the contact to search for.

  • surname (str) – The surname of the contact to search for.

  • email (str) – The email of the contact to search for.

Returns:

The first matching Contact instance or None if no match is found.

Return type:

Contact or None

async src.repository.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieves contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of Contact instances with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactResponse, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Updates an existing contact’s information.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactResponse) – ContactResponse instance containing updated contact information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The User instance representing the user.

Returns:

The updated Contact instance or None if the contact is not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Confirms a user’s email by setting the ‘confirmed’ flag to True.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Creates a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the user to create.

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to create.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user from the database

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Gets a user from the database by email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to get.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user from the database corresponding to the given email.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.remove_user(user: User, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Removes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to remove.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user object

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Updates a user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to get.

  • avatar_url (str) – The URL of the avatar to set.

Returns:

The user from the database corresponding to the given email.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Updates an authentication token for a user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The authentication token to update.

  • user (User) – The user object to update the token for.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

async src.repository.users.update_user(body: UserResponse, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → User¶

Update a user’s information.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • new_data (dict) – The new data for the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The user from the database

Return type:

User

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

A confirmation message.

dict

async src.routes.auth.login_user(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Logs in a user and returns access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm instance containing login information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

TokenModel instance containing access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes an access token using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

TokenModel instance containing the new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Requests email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – RequestEmail instance containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI BackgroundTasks for asynchronous tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request instance containing request information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

A confirmation or information message.

Return type:

dict

Signs up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – UserModel instance containing user information.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI BackgroundTasks for asynchronous tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request instance containing request information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – An asynchronous database session.

Returns:

The created User instance.

Return type:

UserResponseSignupModel

REST API service Auth¶

Module Name: auth.py Description: This module provides authentication and authorization functionalities using FastAPI and JWT tokens.

Contents: - PasswordManager: A class for managing password encryption and verification. - JWTManager: A class for JWT token creation and decoding. - AuthService: A class handling user authentication and authorization.

Dependencies: - fastapi, jose, passlib, datetime, sqlalchemy, src.database.db, src.repository.users1, src.conf.config

Usage: 1. Import the necessary classes and modules:

from src.authentication import PasswordManager, JWTManager, AuthService, oauth2_scheme

  1. Initialize the required settings:

    • secret_key: Secret key used for JWT token encoding.

    • algorithm: JWT token encoding algorithm.

  2. Initialize the authentication service:

    auth_service = AuthService(PasswordManager(), JWTManager(secret_key, algorithm), repository_users, redis_sessionmanager)

  3. Use the authentication service for various operations:

    • authenticate_user(email: str, password: str, db: AsyncSession) -> User: Authenticate a user based on email and password.

    • authorised_user(token: str, db: AsyncSession) -> User: Validate and authorize a user using an access token.

    • create_access_token(user: User) -> str: Create an access token for a user.

    • create_refresh_token(user: User) -> str: Create a refresh token for a user.

    • create_email_token(user: User) -> str: Create an email verification token for a user.

Note: Replace ‘User’ with your actual user class or data structure.

class src.services.auth.AuthService(password_manager, jwt_manager, user_repository, redis)¶

Bases: object

Class providing user authentication and authorization services.

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(user: User, host: str)¶

Email verify the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object for whom the email verification is being sent.

  • host (str) – The hostname or URL where the verification link will point to.
